website_summaries.verdict: If you have a gas stove, this tea kettle is the hands-down winner.
pros: Heats water about 50% faster than typical pot due to unique design of the kettle's bottom
Ergonomic silicone handle stays safe to touch
cons: built to conduct heat from a burner with a flame

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the old version of the TurboPot and decided to treat myself with the upgraded version by purchasing this one. I LOVED the old version. This version SUCKS!! The handle gets super hot and I hate the knob that you have to push up in order to pour the water out. I wish I could just return and purchase the old version. The handle is also a crappy plastic material where as the old one was a soft nice rubber. HATE THIS TEAPOT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Moriah Bailey

customer_reviews.title: When heating more than a cup of water, it ...
customer_reviews.text: When heating more than a cup of water, it certainly is faster and works exactly as advertised. The fins on the base do add a small amount of weight - so for small quantities, the speed advantage is negligible. One additional benefit I've noticed is that there is much less hot air that flows up towards the top of the kettle, so even if you're heating a full pot, the handle doesn't end up getting hot. When you're trying to get that coffee going quickly in the mornings, the faster boil time is definitely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Duy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Heats fast on gas stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement birthday gift for my boyfriend after the electric kettle I bought him quit working after two weeks. He loves it, and it heats up on our gas stove about as quickly as the electric kettle did. This is perfect for him as he drinks about 5-10 cups of instant coffee a day so needs hot water several times a day. Pros: Heats up quickly, nice design, quality materials. Cons: None really but it is a bit heavy. Not a con for my boyfriend though!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel????
customer_reviews.text: After one use, this tea kettle had a ring on the inside that does not wash off. I am not sure what it is, but don't think true stainless should do this. I will be returning this tea kettle and will keep looking.

customer_reviews.title: Very good kettle
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in good condition and performs as advertised. It seems to heat quickly. Pours very nicely. It is a little heavy due to the aluminum fins on the bottom, but it's not terrible. It's easy to pour even with the weight, so long as there is a decent amount of water in the pot. It's nice that there aren't any screw/rivet holes in the sides - looks like it won't easily rust or corrode. It remains to be seen if the handle will hold up, and the knob on the lid could be attached better. Overall I am pleased for the price, and would rate it as "very good".
